newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan money rates end lower on loose liquidity.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan money rates end lower on loose liquidity.

text.p: Taiwan's money rates closed lower on Thursday on high liquidity as of T$5 billion worth of negotiable certificates of deposit matured, dealers said.
Dealers expected the rates to go lower in the near term as more of the NCDs mature on Friday and Saturday.

The overnight interbank rate closed at 5.978 percent against Wednesday's 6.027 percent close -- still outside the central bank's 5.00-5.5 percent target zone -- with 30-day commercial paper falling to 6.00 percent against 6.10.
The maturation of T$5 billion negotiable certificates of deposit on Thursday eased funds in the banking system, dealers said.
In the bond market, the 10-year 86/4 bond yield was at 6.0810-0820 percent against 6.0850-0855.
